titleStmt.title: The petition of the retailing vintners of London, and their propositions and demaundes contrived and made amongst themselves at their hall, in Novemb. 1637. Whereby it may appeare who projected the penny a quart on wines. To the Kings most excellent Majestie: the humble petition of your Majesties loyall subjects, the vintners and others, retaylors of wines, freemen of the citty of London..

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Thomas Walkeley, and are to be sold at his shop, at the signe of the flying Horse, between Brittains Bursse, and Yorke House,,

notesStmt.note: Place of publication suggested by Wing.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.

place.placeName: his shop, at the signe of the flying Horse, between Brittains Bursse
